contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=June 2011}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Deborah Lyons | background = solo_singer | image = Lyons Deb 503 ret.jpg | caption = Deb Lyons in May 2008 | image_size = 220px | origin = | instrument = | genre = | occupation = [[Singer-songwriter]] | years_active = | label = | associated_acts = | website = [http://deblyonsmusic.com deblyonsmusic.com] }} '''Deb Lyons''' is a [[singer-songwriter]] from New York City. She is most associated with her work in [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/archives/entertainment/2000/09/07/2000-09-07__smokey__brings_broadway_home.html|title='SMOKEY' BRINGS BROADWAY HOME|last=Bianculli|first=David|date=September 7, 2000|work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]|accessdate=27 June 2011}}</ref> and is well-recognized for her multiple performances in clubs such as [[The Bitter End]] and The Bottomline. Lyons has recorded with acclaimed composer [[Yuki Kajiura]] on the album ''[[Fiction (Yuki Kajiura album)|Fiction]]'', as well as several songs (including the image theme) for [[Xenosaga II]]. Through remixes, her voice has appeared in [[Xenosaga III]] also. She has sung on jingles for [[Toyota]], [[Jet Blue]], [[Milky Way]], and is the voice of several Fisher Price toys. In addition, Lyons has recorded with [[The Chieftains]] (Further Down the Old Plank Road) and children's artists [[Yosi Levin|Yosi]] and [[Mr. Scott the Music Man]]. Other people Lyons has performed and recorded with include [[Donna Summer]], [[The Mamas & the Papas]], [[Lee Ann Womack]], [[Rosanne Cash]], [[Carrie Underwood]], [[Emily Bindiger]], [[Carolee Goodgold]], [[Jim Barbaro]], [[Margaret Dorn]], [[The Bingo Boys]], [[Gigi on the Beach]], and the [[Ed Palemo Big Band]]. Lyons has been in several stage productions, including a national tour of [[Jekyll & Hyde]], and [[Smokey Joe's Cafe]] on Broadway and [[West End, London]] and regional productions of [[Hairspray (musical)|Hairspray]], [[Side By Side By Sondheim]], and [[Pumpboys & Dinettes]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://deblyonsmusic.com Deb Lyons website] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Lyons, Deb | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lyons, Deb}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American female singers]] [[Category:Songwriters from New York]] [[Category:People from New York City]]
